newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Dow-inspired Australian stocks close firmer.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Dow-inspired Australian stocks close firmer.

text.p: *Shares closed firmer, the market responding to the stronger Dow on Thursday. Total volume 308.24 million shares worth A$740.32 million, 962 stocks traded, 281 steady, 408 rises, 273 falls
Australian shares had a firmer session on Friday, the market closing near its highs after gleaning strength from Wall Street's gains on Thursday.
Turnover was solid, topping A$740 million by the close.

The main share market barometer, the All Ordinaries index, finished up 18.3 points at 2,292.9, just off its intra-day high of 2,293.7. The September share index futures ended 28 points stronger at 2,307, a 13.3 point premium to the underlying index.
Dealers said the market was led higher by News Corp ordinary and preferred stock which surged ahead in anticipation of further gains by the media group in the U.S. later today.
"The market looked like dropping off at lunch time but held steady and found a lot of buying interest in the last hour," said Jim Tredenick, a dealer at Brisbane broker, Nevitts.
Tredenick said investors were looking for another rally from the Dow on Friday and were also encouraged by the possibility of another local interest rate cut in the short term.

Dealers said the stock of major banks was also well sought after in late trade, especially Commonwealth Bank's installment receipts whose high yield was attractive given the prospect of a further rate cut.
"Wall Street traditionally runs higher in the lead up to a U.S. election," Tredenick said.
"This factor combined with Thursday's rate cut in Germany appears to have injected some confidence into the U.S. market which should rub off here next week," he said.

In other markets, both bonds and currency were subdued after a very busy week. Bonds were slightly firmer due to some end of week position-squaring, while the Australian dollar was slightly weaker following a much firmer week.
Turnover in September SPI futures totalled 6,039 (12,661)
